headline: Asian shares sink after losses for Big Tech pull US stocks lower
summary: Tokyo’s benchmark Nikkei 225 index dipped more than 4% on Wednesday and other shares in Asia also were mostly lower after a retreat on Wall Street spurred by selling of Big Tech shares.  U.S. futures were mixed and oil prices also fell.  Shares in energy and tech giant SoftBank Group sank 9.8% on jitters over its investments in artificial intelligence.

content.title: Asian shares sink after losses for Big Tech pull US stocks lower

U.S. futures were mixed and oil prices also fell.  Shares in energy and tech giant SoftBank Group sank 9.8% on jitters over its investments in artificial intelligence.

headline: Jim Cramer Recommends These 4 AI Stocks These Days, Says 'Wise Speculation' Can Change Your Life
summary: CNBC host Jim Cramer has been urging young investors to put their money in individual stocks instead of limiting themselves to index funds if they want to earn substantial profits. He said in a recent program that he is not against "wise" speculation in stock picking, as it can deliver investors outsized gains. "Speculation itself is not bad," Cramer said. headline: Don't panic yet, investors say, as high-flying AI stocks tumble
summary: SINGAPORE (Reuters) -Sharp falls in technology stock prices are cause for caution but not panic yet, say brokers and investors who have been riding a runaway market to record highs and some stretched valuations.  For now, it's the speed and not markets' faith in artificial intelligence that is in question.  "The selloff appears to be largely positioning-driven, with recent outperforming names taking the worst of the move," said Jon Withaar, senior portfolio manager at Pictet Asset Management in Singapore.

content.title: Don't panic yet, investors say, as high-flying AI stocks tumble
content.summary: SINGAPORE (Reuters) -Sharp falls in technology stock prices are cause for caution but not panic yet, say brokers and investors who have been riding a runaway market to record highs and some stretched valuations.  For now, it's the speed and not markets' faith in artificial intelligence that is in question.  "The selloff appears to be largely positioning-driven, with recent outperforming names taking the worst of the move," said Jon Withaar, senior portfolio manager at Pictet Asset Management in Singapore.

headline: Exclusive - China bans foreign AI chips from state-funded data centres, sources say
summary: In recent weeks, Chinese regulatory authorities have ordered such data centres that are less than 30% complete to remove all installed foreign chips,​ or cancel plans to purchase them, while projects in a more advanced stage will be decided on a case-by-case basis, the sources said.  The move could represent one of China's most ‌aggressive steps yet to eliminate foreign technology from its critical infrastructure amid a pause in trade hostilities between Washington and Beijing, and achieve its quest for AI chip self-sufficiency.  China's access to advanced AI chips, including those made by Nvidia, has been a key point of ‌friction with the U.S., as the two wrestle for dominance in high-end computing power and AI.

content.title: Exclusive - China bans foreign AI chips from state-funded data centres, sources say
content.summary: In recent weeks, Chinese regulatory authorities have ordered such data centres that are less than 30% complete to remove all installed foreign chips,​ or cancel plans to purchase them, while projects in a more advanced stage will be decided on a case-by-case basis, the sources said.  The move could represent one of China's most ‌aggressive steps yet to eliminate foreign technology from its critical infrastructure amid a pause in trade hostilities between Washington and Beijing, and achieve its quest for AI chip self-sufficiency.  China's access to advanced AI chips, including those made by Nvidia, has been a key point of ‌friction with the U.S., as the two wrestle for dominance in high-end computing power and AI.

headline: World shares retreat after losses for Big Tech pull US stocks lower
summary: Shares in Europe and Asia retreated Wednesday following a decline on Wall Street spurred by selling of Big Tech shares.  The spillover from Wall Street was evident.  Shares in energy and tech giant SoftBank Group sank 10% on jitters over its investments in artificial intelligence.

content.title: World shares retreat after losses for Big Tech pull US stocks lower
content.summary: Shares in Europe and Asia retreated Wednesday following a decline on Wall Street spurred by selling of Big Tech shares.  The spillover from Wall Street was evident.  Shares in energy and tech giant SoftBank Group sank 10% on jitters over its investments in artificial intelligence.
